poem:
**Listening to the Pulse**

Songs threading through history  
A million voices cast  
To shape a new moment—  
INXS rises, a chord struck  
In endless air,  
Timeless as sun on Sydney sand.  
Questions flutter  
In the heat of discovery,  
Echoed in hearts beating  
To an Australian rhythm,  
As familiar as shared laughter,  
As wild as the sea.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Five burning questions from Triple J’s Australian Hottest 100, a ‘rare and precious thing’ More than 2.6 million people voted in Triple J’s Hottest 100 of Australian Songs poll, anointing INXS as the Aussiest of Aussie bands for their classic anthem Never Tear Us Apart. The full list spans decades, genres and regions. But there were some key standouts – and some burning questions – as the results rolled in on Saturday afternoon. How did". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
